member.name: M:Beamable.Server.BeamableMicroService.ResolveCustomInitializationHook
member.summary: Handles custom initialization hooks. Makes the following assumptions: - User defined at least one over a static async method that returns a and receives a . - Any exception will fail loudly and prevent the C#MS from receiving traffic.

member.name: T:Beamable.Server.MicroserviceLogFormatter
member.summary: Taken from the compact renderer; and adapted to work without @ symbols An that writes events in a compact JSON format, for consumption in environments without message template support. Message templates are rendered into text and a hashed event id is included.

member.name: M:Beamable.Server.MicroserviceLogFormatter.Format(Serilog.Events.LogEvent,System.IO.TextWriter)
member.summary: Format the log event into the output. Subsequent events will be newline-delimited.

member.name: M:Beamable.Server.MicroserviceLogFormatter.FormatEvent(Serilog.Events.LogEvent,System.IO.TextWriter,Serilog.Formatting.Json.JsonValueFormatter)
member.summary: Format the log event into the output.
member.param: A value formatter for s on the event.

member.name: M:Beamable.Server.MicroserviceRequester.Acknowledge(Beamable.Server.RequestContext,Beamable.Server.WebsocketErrorResponse)
member.summary: Acknowledge a message from the websocket.
member.param: The request you wish to ack
an error, or null for a 200 ack.

member.name: M:Beamable.Server.MicroserviceRequester.InitializeSubscription
member.summary: Each socket only needs to set up one subscription to the server. All events will get piped to the client. It's the client job to filter the events, and decide what is valuable.

member.name: M:microservice.Common.AdminRoutes.HealthCheck
member.summary: A simple method to check if the microservice can send and receive network traffic.
member.returns: The word "responsive" if all is well.

member.name: M:microservice.Common.AdminRoutes.Docs
member.summary: Generates an OpenAPI/Swagger 3.0 document that describes the available service endpoints.
member.remarks: Any [ClientCallable] methods on the service will be included in the generated OpenAPI document. Any doc-comments on the methods will be included in the generated document. The summary, remarks, returns, and parameter tags are supported.
